intro: Stenanthemum argenteum, commonly known as silver stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its silvery-white, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and dry forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment.
